race.name: Serenissima Gravel
race.tagline: Italian flat to rolling gravel near Venice.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads near Venice. Minimal to moderate elevation with Venice area scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional Italian event. Flat to rolling terrain near Venice with moderate organization and regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: Serenissima Gravel is a regional event near Venice, Italy‚Äîflat to rolling terrain with minimal elevation. The Venice area is scenic, but the moderate organization and regional field keep it firmly in Tier 3.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A scenic Italian gravel race near Venice. Worth it for European cyclists. Not a destination race for international travelers.

final_verdict.one_liner: Italian flat to rolling gravel near Venice.
final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're in Italy/Europe‚Äîyes, it's solid. If you're international‚Äîthere are better options.
final_verdict.alternatives: For similar Italian events: Veneto Gravel. For more elevation: Italian mountain races.

logistics.lodging_strategy: Venice area has good lodging options.
logistics.food: Venice area has full dining options. Stock nutrition.

course_description.signature_challenge: Venice area flat to rolling gravel.

non_negotiables.why: Flat to rolling terrain requires sustained effort.
Flat to rolling terrain requires pacing discipline.

marketplace_variables.race_hook: Italian flat to rolling gravel near Venice.
marketplace_variables.race_hook_detail: Regional event with Venice area scenery.

logistics.explanation: The race delivers on operational execution despite changing course layout between editions - moving from Jesolo to Porto Barricata to Cittadella over four years. Winner Alexey Lutsenko called it "an unforgettable experience," while Giuseppe Martinelli noted "it was such a beautiful race, a bit technical and difficult, especially from the start, but still nice and spectacular."

length.explanation: Lutsenko's winning solo attack came with 80km remaining, sustaining "3.5 hours of 100 percent full gas" through the 132km parcours. The distance allows for tactical racing as Robin Froidevaux demonstrated in 2022, attacking 10km from home: "I knew if I stayed with the group, it would be hard technically against the best on the last lap." Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: Lutsenko described "very narrow roads and so many corners" on the technical parcours, with 83% gravel surfaces including single-track through the Po Delta. Community observers noted sections "so tight that even on a leisure ride on them, you'd have to single out," though the course lacks "wide-open stretches of stones like those found in races Stateside." Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: The Po Delta and Villa Contarini terrain offers minimal climbing challenge, staying near sea level throughout the Veneto countryside. The 2000 feet over 65 miles reflects gentle agricultural landscape where tactical positioning on narrow gravel sectors matters more than climbing power. Flatter profile than Croatan Buck Fifty. As Robin Froidevaux puts it: "For sure it was unexpected. I'm not too much of a gravel specialist and even in mountain bike, I'm not so good technically, but I took the opportunity and went on the attack."

climate.explanation: Mid-October in the Veneto region typically delivers stable gravel conditions before winter sets in. The Po Delta climate stays moderate during late autumn, though the coastal proximity near Porto Barricata and agricultural valleys can create variable micro-weather across the changing course layouts. Similar climate challenges to SBT GRVL.

altitude.explanation: Racing from the Po Delta through Villa Contarini keeps the entire route at essentially sea level elevation. The coastal start points near Venice and agricultural finish locations maintain consistent low altitude throughout, making oxygen availability irrelevant to race outcomes. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds ‚Äî no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: The race traverses through Treviso "a city of 100,000 inhabitants" entirely on gravel roads, showcasing ancient Veneto charm around the 16th-century Villa Contarini. TheBlaaMan noted the "beautiful but nuts" nature of racing on footpaths outside houses at "40-50kmph," delivering cultural immersion beyond typical gravel events.

prestige.explanation: As the "first-ever pro-only gravel event on the calendar" created by Milano-Sanremo winner Filippo Pozzato, the race attracts WorldTour talent like Lutsenko and Hermans from teams including Astana-Premier Tech and Alpecin-Deceuninck. However, the small 40-rider fields limit its broader impact in professional cycling hierarchy.

race_quality.explanation: The no-radio, self-supported format creates pure racing dynamics, with Lutsenko describing choosing his tactic as "Alexey, go as fast as you can" without team communication. However, scalability issues emerge - community observers noted "no way are you getting a full peloton of 200 on those roads" due to extreme sector narrowness.

experience.explanation: The stripped-down racing format eliminates team cars and radios, forcing self-reliance that Lutsenko described as "a feeling that I hadn't felt in a long time." Riccardo Minali captured the essence: "It was a difficult race, but we really had fun. I'm looking forward to participating in more gravel races in the future!"

community.explanation: Giuseppe Martinelli's enthusiasm - "It is a new but so nice race which must go on in the next years" - reflects broader professional reception to the innovative format. The race attracts pros seeking "the cycling of the past" heroic style, though the inaugural gender equity issue drew criticism from Alison Tetrick about excluding women from "MY sport."

field_depth.explanation: WorldTour teams bring serious depth with Astana-Premier Tech, Cofidis, and Alpecin-Deceuninck participating alongside Italian ProTeams. The small ~40-rider fields concentrate talent effectively, though Macy0161 noted that with larger pelotons "it becomes more about the fight for position on the tarmac sections entering the sectors." Less competitive depth than Almanzo 100.

value.explanation: The pro-only format with WorldTour participation creates distinctive racing unavailable elsewhere in gravel. Part of Pozzato's four-race "Ride the Wonderland" series, organizers aim to "create a stadium atmosphere" where spectators can see multiple race stages, with future plans including starts from Piazza San Marco.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs ‚Ç¨60-100. Venice proximity inflates accommodation costs in one of Europe's most expensive tourist regions. The race requires premium equipment like Lutsenko's "brand new: almost literally fresh out of the factory" Wilier Rave SLR, while Filippo Pozzato uses custom Passoni titanium frames with "same geometry as when I was racing" - reflecting the professional-grade investment expected. Higher total cost than Badlands.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Panaracer GravelKing SK
primary.why: Affordable all-rounder. Light knobs add grip without killing speed.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

videos.title: Unsupported Grinder: 300km Gravel Race - Pas Normal Studios
videos.description:
Unsupported Grinder presented by Pas Normal Studios. 

300km of mixed terrain through some of Denmark's most diverse areas. Follow our team as they take on the first edition of Unsupported Grinder.

videos.title: Gravel SERENISSIMA tra laguna, fiumi, forti e Ville Venete
videos.description:
Partenza dal Parco Laghetti di Martellago per proseguire tra le campagne di Robegano, Salzano, Mirano fino a Villa Farsetti che sorge nel territorio agricolo di Santa Maria di Sala. Realizzata nel XVIII secolo, di fronte ad essa si estendono i suoi giardini ‚Äúalla francese‚Äù.
Si continua verso la Riviera del Brenta fino alla regina delle Ville venete: Villa Pisani, detta la Nazionale.
Si raggiungono, attraverso piacevoli ciclabili, prima Mira Porte e poi Malcontenta.
Costeggiando il Naviglio del Brenta si arriva a Punta Fusina dove √® possibile spezzare la fame ammirando il panorama della citt√† lagunare.
Si rientra verso la terraferma passando per Oriago di Mira, C√† Sabbioni e Marghera.
Attraverso il sottopasso ferroviario si giunge al complesso storico di Forte Marghera.
Da qui poi √® molto vicino il Parco San Giuliano di Mestre dove si pu√≤ nuovamente godere del panorama di Venezia. 
Si attraversa la citt√† di Mestre tra le sicure e ben segnalate ciclabili e si arriva poi in zona Gazzera e Asseggiano. 
Da qui si prende la Nuovissima Ciclabile della Valsugana e via Frassinelli, dove tra ciclabili e sterrati, si arriva a Olmo di Martellago, Maerne e infine si rientra in zona Parco Laghetti¬†a¬†Martellago.

Distanza percorsa: 124 km  | Dislivello: 170 m | Tempo di percorrenza: 5h  30 minuti  | Adatto Gravel, Mtb, E-bike

videos.title: GRAVEL A TREVISO E DINTORNI - LAGO LE BANDIE
videos.description:
Gravel in provincia di Treviso e per la precisione il Lago le Bandie. "Gravellando con Ilenia" format promosso dall'UC 2000 e in onda su Scratch  
Mercoled√¨ ore 21:00 su Canale Italia 84 digitale terrestre
Gioved√¨ ore 21:00 su Bike, canale 259 del digitale terrestre
questa settimana vi porta a scoprire le bellezze dell'entroterra trevigiano, tra la Treviso- Ostiglia e la Ciclabile del Sile.


Intervista a Mara Mosole.

videos.title: URBAN BIKE TOUR: una Mestre insolita in bici tra natura¬†e¬†citt√†
videos.description:
Partenza lungo la ciclabile che costeggia il Terraglio per immergerci poi nelle campagne che ci portano nel il Bosco di Mestre tra Dese e Favaro Veneto. Si possono ammirare specie arboree tipiche della pianura tra il Bosco Franca, Ottolenghi e Zaher. 
Nell‚Äô ultima parte, vicino al Dese, si incontra Forte Cosenz, in cemento armato, il primo dei tanti forti che ammireremo. Furono costruiti dall‚Äô800 in difesa di Venezia quello che √® conosciuto come il Campo Trincerato di Mestre.
Una volta abbandonate queste strutture militari, sono andate per lo pi√π nell‚Äô abbandono e ricoperte dalla vegetazione.
Si prosegue verso Forte Bazzera nella zona di Tessera, questa √© la parte di percorso dove manca una vera pista ciclabile ma la strada non √® particolarmente trafficata.
Questo forte √® l‚Äôunica polveriera giunta fino ai giorni nostri.
Da qui inizia uno dei tratti pi√π belli: una ciclabile sterrata che costeggia la laguna e a vista si notano i campanili della citt√† di Venezia.
Superata l‚Äô idrovora e Passo Campalto si raggiunge velocemente Parco San Giuliano, uno dei pi√π grandi d‚Äô Europa.
Attraversando il ponte ciclopedonale e viale San Marco si arriva a Forte Marghera.
Fu costruito dagli austriaci √® terminato poi dai francesi. √à il primo esemplare di fortificazione a difesa di Venezia e del suo arsenale e uno dei pi√π maestosi.
All‚Äôinterno si pu√≤ sostare in uno dei tanti locali carini o visitare i Mici del Forte, un‚Äô associazione locale che si prende cura dei gatti abbandonati.
Prendiamo poi la ciclabile lungo via Torino, il sottopasso della stazione per arrivare a Marghera.
Attraversiamo poi la Romea grazie al sottopasso e proseguiamo tra territori agresti.
Lungo il percorso si pu√≤ ammirare la Torre Colombara in stile gotico risalente alla prima met√† del XIX secolo.
Facendo un po‚Äô di attenzione dove termina la strada secondaria, sulla destra si prosegue verso Forte Tron. Si gira intorno alla vegetazione che lo copre interamente fino a scoprirlo, quasi come un tesoro nascosto. 
√à il gemello di Forte Capenedo e Forte Gazzera. √à ora un‚Äôoasi di protezione della flora e della fauna che l‚Äôhanno colonizzato.
Si continua verso Oriago per giungere a Forte Gazzera tra il Marzenego e il Dosa. Ogni prima domenica del mese √® aperto per la visita.
Si continua per arrivare a Zelarino e in localit√† Gatta dove si trova il Forte Mezzacapo dove non √® pi√π visibile il fossato che √® stato interrato. Era stato costruito nel 1911 per controllare la strada per Treviso e la ferrovia per Udine.
Da qui lungo una piacevole ciclabile si torna facilmente al parcheggio per concludere questo piacevole¬†itinerario.

Distanza percorsa: 62 km  | Dislivello: 130 m | Tempo di percorrenza: 3 h  30 m  | Adatto Gravel, Mtb,  E-bike
